takeaways: Let me tell you something that wrecked me: I thought guilt was me
As a teen I got mocked for being awkward
As a kid I got in trouble for daydreaming too much
So I started believing I was all of that — and worse
And somewhere between my first meltdown and my last missed deadline
source_title: 🧨 I wasn’t born with guilt — it was given to me
